reviewText: My kids ages 2,4,6,9,&11 all love this DVD. We plan now to buy all in the buck Denver series. Loved it
We love Buck Denver! My 3 year old grandson really enjoys all the Buck Denver DVDs. When I found out that my son's college friends, Rett and Link, were part of this production I loved it even more.
It is a great video and way better then yeggie tales. It is a great video and worth every pennie
My kids love these series.  Now that they are older this is a great fit, after Veggie Tales and packed with information presented in a fun way that keeps even my boisterous boys captivated.
I thought it was okay...will probably only use it for special events because I didn't really like how the message was brought across.

Phil Vischer has produced two videos based on the series he produced called Buck Denver Asks Whats in the Bible? This video series contains six to seven vignettes where unknown childrens questions get answered. Each vignette follows the same template. The first scene is Buck Denver in the newsroom introducing a question he is investigating. For example, in the first vignette, he is asking questions about the kangaroo. Before he can get to a report, he is interrupted by an unnamed newsroom worker who tells him to take the call which is flashing on the monitor behind him.
Then after finding out what the question is, the scene quickly changed to Clive and Ians Wonder-Blimp of Knowledge. Clive and Ian sing an intro song and ask the monkey who is driving the blimp to take them to a location to answer the question. After a moment they arrive but it is not a physical location but a place where they receive the signal from someone who can answer the question.
Now this is where the kids question can be answered.

The first DVD answers 6 questions, Emily asks Who made the Universe?, Diego asks Is God as powerful as a superhero?, Latasha  asks, How old is God?, Alexander asks, Does God love me even when I make bad choices?, Jessica asks, Is God with me when I am afraid?, and Megan asks, Can I count on God?. All the answers are very theologically accurate with one reservation.

I was particularly interested in the answer to the first question because it included statements about origins. Each question is answered by an expert and in this case it is a character named Dr. Shniffenhowzen. He starts by talking about all the energy in the universe and then says science tells us that energy cannot be created but can only be changed from one form to another. So the answer is beyond science. I found this answer well done and quite a clever one.
The question he says science cannot answer is how did life begin?
Ian responds that Darwin would say they evolved and the Dr. clarifies by saying that Darwins theory only talks about how creatures change a little bit over time. It doesnt say anything about how living creatures came about in the first place. Darwins theory didn't say about where life came from.
So the universe and life came from God because the Bible tells us so.

I find this clarification initially very comforting but then I realized the video never refutes Darwins theory of change. He leaves the idea of microevolution as a valid theory which fits in with his portrayal of the creation story in the other video Buck Denver Asks Whats in the Bible?.

So with this caution in mind, I would recommend this video series as a valid way to help children learn biblical answers to their probing questions.

I have always enjoyed Phil Vischer and his sense of humor so when I saw his name, I just had to have this.  He did not disappoint!  The kids and I enjoyed these and I intend to purchase many more of these for family soon!  Phil presents questions that kids ask and provides a fun and quirky way of explaining God's answers.  Kids 5yo to 12yo to adults enjoy Phil's work here.  This is the first of two dvds.
fun & educational
well done!
Very good presentation of important questions that almost everyone wants answers to.  It gives a sense of peace knowing that God's love is limitless and perfect.

excellent, informative product . Blessings to the producers for making such a entertaining and helpful series which translates Biblical content for audiences in a reverent, yet fun way. very worth-while to purchase for our children (and families).

I received my order exactly as presented and on time.  I have not yet viewed the DVDs as yet because they are a Christmas gift for my 5 year old granddaughter.  However, when visiting us,  she was exposed to them at the Sunday School at our church.  I asked the teacher about them and she referred me with high recommendations.
My kids enjoy this series and this was justa pleasant addition to the blessings they have been to them and me too! I've learbed lots that I didn't know.
Awesome video series.  My son has all of them and watches them over and over.

The Buck Denver Whats in the Bible series was a HUGE success with our four children. Their ages range from 12 to 5. They watch them over and over again without tiring of them. They love the puppet characters so much, and they were so excited to get a new movie about Clive and Ian!

I tried to cancel this order but was unsuccessful.  I loved Veggie tales but somehow this falls short and the children weren't interested in watching it.  I had high hopes but this series disappointed.
ordered 2 sets of the whole series, one for the grandchildren and another for Sunday School, well done series even the adults are learning
Great item.
This is SO Perfect for kids and Adults too . Well done !
This video of short clips does a great job of getting some great discussions going for a change of pace in Sunday school.
A wonderful way to initiate a discussion on extremely important topics and questions for kids!

Our church is very multicultural-lots of immigrants, particularly the Karen people from Myanmar & refugee camps in Thailand.  These lessons seem to captivate & teach all, & this is not easy with language barriers, cultural differences, etc.  Our church library has 6 of the 11 DVD's of the original series, & as funds permit will complete the entire package.  We love & appreciate it & so do our kids!
Amazing
Excellent values and content. I and my grand-kids are hugs Veggietale fans. These DVD's are great to have.
